result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/1/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

IN CUSTODY

09:48 AM Defendant Anthony M Moore in court with attorney Haley Ruesch Watson. Prosecuting Atty Trisha L Simmons appeared for State of Wisconsin.     Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1, 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count 3 .

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 90 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence F/W 

COUNT 2 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; cs to Ct 1

-Days credit for time served: 87 days 
-Days credit to jail: 87 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1, 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days.


-Restitution: State has  30  days to submit order. 

-The Court orders DNA sample


-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

for competency exam.
Competency hearing on April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Clara J or Kimber L.
  - Defendant shall not be on any University of Wisconsin-Madison property as defined by the attached map.
  Trial Judge - Br 13

02:28 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Victim appeared and made statement.   The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
